subject: Law
title: The Clean Water Act
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Clean Water Act.

hook.text: Before 1972, factories dumped waste into rivers legally. The Clean Water Act made that a federal crime.

buildup.text: The Clean Water Act regulates pollutant discharges into US waters and sets water quality standards.

discovery.text: Any 'point source' discharge needs an NPDES permit. That includes factories, sewage plants, and stormwater systems.

twist.text: Sackett v. EPA (2023) narrowed the definition of 'waters of the US,' removing protections for many wetlands.

climax.text: Despite progress, 50% of US rivers and streams remain too polluted for swimming or fishing.

punchline.text: Clean water is regulated. Clean water everywhere is still the unfinished goal.

quiz.question: What does the NPDES permit regulate?
